question: The gimbal ring of a turn co-ordinator is inclined at about 30° with respect to the aircraft’s longitudinal axis in order:

choices.choice: make the gyro more effective during inverted flight
make the gyro sensitive to banking of the aircraft as well as turning
make the rate of turn more accurate
have a higher rotor speed which will prolong the life of the instrument

explanation: The spring-restrained gyroscope, mounted at a 30-degree tilt, enhances the instrument’s ability to detect and display both yaw and roll motions, making it a critical tool for ensuring accurate turn coordination and maintaining safe flight.
subject: Instruments

question: A turn co-ordinator has (i) ….. pivoted (ii) …….. in the case
explanation:
A turn coordinator has one gimbal: 

  • Turn coordinator: The turn coordinator’s gimbal is pitched up 30 degrees from the transverse axis, which allows it to respond to both roll and yaw.

 

The gyroscope is spring restrained and is mounted so that the axis is at about 30 degrees with
respect to the aircraft longitudinal axis, thus making the gyroscope sensitive to banking of the
aircraft as well as to turning
subject: Instruments

question: If an aircraft turns as indicated in Figure 1:

choices.choice: the aircraft is turning left at less than 3°/ second
the aircraft is turning left at 3°/ second
it will take one minute to turn through 90°
the aircraft will turn through 180° in two minutes

explanation: • The longitudinal axis of the gyro gimbal is NOT inclined at 30° to the horizontal,  the gyro will NOT respond to banking as well as turning input force. HENCE LESS THAN 3°/ second
